greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sum(k>=0, 1/2^floor(k*phi) ) where phi = (1+sqrt(5))/2.
comment: Number whose digits are obtained from the substitution system (1->(1,0),0->(1)).
The n-th term of the continued fraction is 2^Fibonacci(n-2) ) (cf. A000301).
This number is known to be transcendental.
reference: S. Wolfram, "A new kind of science", p. 913
link: J. L. Davison, A series and its associated continued fraction, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 63 (1977), pp. 29-32.
program: (PARI) phi=(1+sqrt(5))/2; suminf(n=0,2.^-(n*phi\1)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 22 2013
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 19 2002
